title: Pegwell Bay Country Park Walking and Cycle Route

images.title: John Baker / Chalk Cliffs, Pegwell Bay
images.caption: Chalk Cliffs, Pegwell Bay

images.title: david mills / Pegwell Bay, Kent
images.caption:
Photo taken from the Cliffsend to Pegwell path.
To the right are houses along the Sandwich Road and in the background is the disused Richborough Power Station.
In the middle of the photo, jutting into the bay, is the disused Hovercraft landing pad.

images.title: Rose and Trev Clough / Off-road cycle track at Pegwell Bay
images.caption: Off-road cycle track at Pegwell Bay. Part of Regional Cycle Route 15, about half way between Sandwich and Ramsgate.

images.title: Rose and Trev Clough / Cafe at Pegwell Bay Nature Reserve
images.caption: Cafe at Pegwell Bay Nature Reserve. A hut named "The Dog Walker's Rest", which has presumably replaced the mobile cafe which was there in March 2008.

images.title: Colin Smith / The English have Landed
images.caption: The English have Landed. This boat at Ebbsfleet, is supposed to be a replica of the "Hugin". The first Angles to come to England was reputedly, Hengist and his men in 449 and it is thought they landed here.

images.title: david mills / A view of the Pegwell Bay hotel from the beach
images.caption: A view of the Pegwell Bay hotel from the beach

description: This park is located near Ramsgate and has splendid views over Pegwell Bay and Sandwich Bay. In the bay is a large nature reserve, known for its migrating waders and wildfowl. A local cycle route runs right through the park so you can take your bike. To extend your walking in the Ramsgate area you can pick up the Thanet Coastal Path and enjoy a splendid coastal walk from Ramsgate to Margate . The Sandwich Walk visits the River Stour and the ancient Roman amphitheatre at Richborough Castle.
